bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: a) of the third stage of zou ma ya gan 走馬牙疳 , running horse dental gan -illness, with signs of the first stage peng sha 崩砂 , collapsing sand, and second stage kui cao 潰槽 , bursting trough, as well as appearance of blood. HYKY 18: 又盛血出，名曰宣露 , “When even more abundant, blood appears. This is called ‘drained dew ’”.
b) Identical with ya xuan 牙宣 , tooth exposure. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 6: 凡齒齦宣露，多是疳䘌及月蝕 , “Cases of teeth and gums exposure are mostly gan -illness with hidden worms and lunar eclipse”.
